page.title: 03THE WORK AT WITTON HALL FARM
page.content: We also visited Witton Hall Farm.The farmer was Mr Mack.He has 475 acres of land.The type of{land}is light loam. He has 180 cows,90 of them are young calves.He grew different types of crops like barley ,wheat,sugar beet, ,peas,beans and kale.Some staff start work at 5.00 a.m. others at 7.30 a.m. His staff finish work between 4.30 and 6.30p.m.They milk the{cows}at 5.30a.m. and 3.30p.m.His cows eat sugar beet and kale.They are left out at night in summer.He sells cows and their{milk}to the Milk Marketing Board and at the Market.80% of food for the cows is home grown.Some of the cows are sold and bought at an auction.He uses a combine to harvest his crops,for sugar beet is part of a{co-operative}which has a six drill harvester.The crops are sold to local feed merchants, British Sugar Corp. and Ross foods.
